titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress upholding the Makah Tribe treaty rights.
Expressing the sense of the Congress upholding the Makah Tribe treaty rights.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 21 - 6.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 109-283.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 116.

bill.summary: States that Congress disapproves of requiring the Makah Tribe to obtain a waiver and a permit under the Marine Mammal Protection Act of 1972 before taking gray whales, and expresses its intent that the U.S. government should uphold the Tribe's treaty rights.
